macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Rally on Eased Trump-Greenland Tensions
items.summary: US stock indexes rebounded strongly with the Dow Jones up 588 points (1.2%) to 49,077, S&P 500 up 1.2% to 6,875, and Nasdaq up 1.2% to 23,224, recovering half of prior losses after Trump softened rhetoric on Greenland at Davos.

items.title: S&P 500 Nears Record High After Trump Davos Speech
items.summary: The S&P 500 rallied 78.76 points to 6,875.62 following Trump's de-escalation on Greenland dispute, pulling closer to its all-time high; Dow jumped 588.64 points while Nasdaq gained 270.50.

items.title: Netflix Shares Drop Despite Profit Beat on Subscriber Concerns
items.summary: Netflix stock fell 2.2% despite stronger-than-expected profits, as investors focused on slowing subscriber growth and lower-than-expected current quarter profit forecast.

items.title: Kraft Heinz Plunges on Berkshire Hathaway Sell Warning
items.summary: Kraft Heinz shares sank 5.7% after Berkshire Hathaway signaled potential sale of its 325 million shares, following a prior $3.76 billion write-down and board resignations.

items.title: Gold Hits Record High Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Gold surged to another record as markets reacted to Greenland tensions easing, while natural gas rose 20%; Treasury yields eased in response to stock recovery.

items.title: Dow Jones Tests Key Technical Levels Post-Rebound
items.summary: Dow Jones broke out above 49,000 momentum pivot but stalled at 200-MA (48,978); remaining above 48,700 supports rebound chances ahead of PCE/GDP data.

items.title: Nasdaq Remains Bearish in Descending Sequence
items.summary: Nasdaq failed to hold above 25,000 pivotal support, with correction retracing morning rally; mid-term outlook stays bearish for tech-heavy index.

items.title: S&P 500 Tests Critical Support at 6,830-6,850
items.summary: S&P 500 approaches key session support zone of 6,830-6,850; rebound from here could improve prospects amid ongoing uncertainty.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Nasdaq Predicts Bitcoin Could Soar 117% to $200,000 in 2026
items.summary: Analysts forecast Bitcoin reaching $200,000 this year despite recent 26% drop from $126,000 all-time high, with some predicting up to $250,000. Wall Street predictions from last year failed to materialize as Bitcoin ended 2025 with losses below $100,000.

items.title: Columbia Professor Calls NYSE Tokenization Plan 'Vaporware'
items.summary: The New York Stock Exchange's blockchain-based tokenized securities platform lacks critical details on blockchains, stablecoins, jurisdictions, and DeFi integration, criticized as preserving intermediaries rather than innovating.

items.title: Op-Ed: Delaying Crypto Regulation Is a Policy Mistake
items.summary: Unresolved issues like custody rules, platform supervision, disclosures, and SEC-CFTC jurisdiction persist post-FTX failures; rules should be set now before market leverage rebuilds.

items.title: Major Crypto Policy Week in DC Targets $17.52B US Market
items.summary: Crypto companies push policy in Washington amid projections of global market growth from $5.74 billion in 2024 to $17.52 billion.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Tech CEOs at Davos Discuss AI's Impact on Future Jobs
items.summary: Leaders including Jensen Huang, Satya Nadella, and Marc Benioff gathered at the World Economic Forum to debate AI's employment implications. Forrester research estimates AI could displace 10.4 million US jobs by 2030, while tech executives emphasize emerging opportunities in trade skills and datacenter operations.

items.title: Mila and Inovia Capital Launch Venture Scientist Fund for AI Startups
items.summary: Canada's premier AI research institute Mila and leading investor Inovia Capital announced a new early-stage venture capital fund to commercialize frontier AI research. The initiative aims to bridge Canada's gap between its 10% share of global AI research talent and less than 2% of AI venture capital investment.

items.title: Anthropic Invests $1.5M in Python Software Foundation for AI Security
items.summary: Anthropic committed $1.5 million to the Python Software Foundation to enhance security in CPython and the Python Package Index. The investment will fund automated security systems and malware detection tools, addressing critical infrastructure for AI and machine learning development.

items.title: Microsoft Reports $88 Billion AI Investment Spending
items.summary: Microsoft disclosed it spent $88 billion on AI-related investments in its 2025 fiscal year and plans to increase spending further in 2026, underscoring major tech companies' commitment to AI infrastructure and development.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct Scheduled for January 22 with Major Game Reveals
items.summary: Microsoft's Xbox Developer Direct 2026 airs today at 1:00 PM ET, featuring first gameplay looks at Fable, the official reveal of Forza Horizon 6 from Playground Games, and Game Freak's Beast of Reincarnation, a post-apocalyptic action RPG. Rumors suggest a surprise fourth game announcement, continuing the event's tradition of unexpected reveals.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade Launches on Nintendo Switch 2
items.summary: Square Enix releases Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade on Nintendo Switch 2 today, January 22, 2026, earning high praise for its stunning visuals, consistent performance, and status as a gold standard port for the platform. The action RPG delivers the acclaimed story and gameplay from its original 2020 launch, now optimized for handheld play.[5]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Launches Largest Retail Store in Chicago Suburbs
items.summary: Amazon opened its largest-ever retail store with a footprint larger than many Big Box stores in the Chicago suburbs, marking a significant expansion of its physical retail presence.

items.title: Teledyne Technologies Reports Earnings Beat
items.summary: Teledyne Technologies, a maker of electronic instruments, reported quarterly earnings that exceeded Wall Street estimates, driving shares higher.
